title: Calories in a Smashburger
meta_description: Discover calories in a smashburger, including full nutrition breakdown like protein, fat, carbs, and easy tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Single 4 oz (113 g) 80/20 ground beef patty, smashed and cooked; American cheese slice; potato bun; lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles; mustard and ketchup. No fries or sides.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by restaurant, patty size, meat blend, toppings, and cooking method. Check menus or labels for exact values.

quick_answer.text: A smashburger typically contains about 550 kcal, with 30 g protein and 40 g carbs from the bun.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Double patty (add another 4 oz beef patty)

faqs.q: How many calories in a smashburger?
faqs.a: About 550 kcal for a standard single-patty smashburger with cheese and basic toppings.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a smashburger?
faqs.a: Roughly 30 g from the beef patty and cheese.
Yes, around 850 mg due to seasonings, bun, and condiments.

faqs.q: How does smashburger nutrition compare to regular burgers?
faqs.a: Similar calories, but smashing creates more crust, potentially adding flavor without extra fat.

faqs.q: Can I make a lower-calorie smashburger?
faqs.a: Opt for leaner beef (90/10), skip cheese, and use whole-grain bun to reduce by 100-150 kcal.
